thread.title: No need to fine-tune QE: ECB policymaker
thread.title_full: No need to fine-tune QE: ECB policymaker | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: No need to fine-tune QE: ECB policymaker
text:
A member of the European Central Bank's Governing Council has voiced resistance to a quick acceleration of the ECB's large-scale bond buying program, even as inflation in the currency bloc sits in negative territory.
"I feel in your questions and market sentiments, everybody is asking, what you will do additionally," said Vitas Vasiliauskas, governor of the central bank of Lithuania, the eurozone's newest member. "My message is very clear: There is no need for any additional measures," he said in an interview Saturday with The Wall Street Journal.
He said that at the ECB's upcoming meeting this month and again at the next policy meeting in December, the Governing Council will examine data and economic developments but "for the moment, I don't see any need for additional stimulus, additional fine-tuning of the program."
